He considers the content of the reading to be absolute and not part of debates.  He grades very hard and tries to show how he is superior than you, the student.
He is amazing. Sitting in his class is like watching a movie. Everybody should take a class with him.
No Comments
Enjoyed her class. Very passionate and discussions are engaging.
Awesome Prof!

If you have any interest in art history take the into class WITH Molholt! She is awesome. it was a 200+ person lecture class, and yet she led most sections for the class and knew almost all of her students names. Her lectures and power points are also super clear.

Professor Molholt's lectures are dreamy. They are clear and focused and you leave with a real sense of having learned something. She gives context and purpose for each work of art, though admittedly some major artists are completely left out of the course. Do not miss the chance to take a course with her. One of the best courses I've taken.
A very nice guy, not a very clear lecturer, but definitely wants his students to succeed. Go to office hours for a better explanation of class content. His teaching assistant was awesome.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Professor Kim is a very kind person and you can tell he loves engineering and loves teaching. However, his lectures are not clear at all, leaving the class completely confused about what went on in class. His lecture slides are disorganized with some irrelevant information. He is more helpful in office hours, and the TAs for ENGN 31 saved everyone.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: A real gem. His class was very difficult (hard tests, not much time to do them), so grading was a bit rough, but it is well worth the amount you learn from him. There were two professors who taught this class, but I honestly wish that Larry Larson taught it fully. The man loves EE and it shows.

Dean Larson is such a caring guy who is so passionate about EE and teaches in a relaxed manner that makes learning a stressless experience. Due to COVID-19, we had to transition to remote learning, and every single class he would apologize to us even though it was by no means any fault of his. (His class is difficult, though, but you learn so much)

She cares so much about the formatting of the code, even though the autograder ran perfectly, the TAs will still take 30% off the grade for no testing section. There are no drops on homework which leaves no room for error. This is not an environment for wanting students to succeed. She seems really out of it when I try to ask questions after class
Not great at explaining things clearly. Makes concepts more complicated / unapproachable than they need to be.
He was nice.  However not a fan of the grading system, your grade consists of 3 exams and 3 exams only, and a 95 or above is an A.  One mistake and you have an A- automatically in the class.

Professor Usatine is a very passionate individual and it shows through his lectures. He spent a long time on derivations and proofs for the concepts we learned in class, and this made it feel slow at times, but it built lin alg foundations quite strong. He is very receptive to questions and incredibly patient.
This professors website/notes are the holy grail. Learn a lot but also get great grade because notes are insanely easy to read and thorough.

Amazing professor who understands how to explain things clearly. No book needed, lecture notes are provided at the start of the semester (for the whole semester, so read ahead). Grading standards are clear, and grades come out at a steady pace. Some homework assignments have tougher questions, but he links his YouTube channel where he solves them.
Very kind professor
Completely clueless about the material he was teaching. Sometimes rude towards student and was constantly condescending.

She gives very clear lectures and is such a nice and approachable professor if you have any questions. Tests are very long and include pages of free response, but she offers a lot of partial credit and extra credit that helps cushion your grade a lot. 100% recommend this class for anyone interested in biology.
Very intelligent and informative, worked hard to explain difficult ideas, and was very open to student needs and concerns--even reached out to me as one of the few freshman in her class.

He seemed so nervous at first but became really great by the end of the semester. He seems to know his stuff and a lot of people. It was his first semester, so I guess it's easier to be nice about it. Really cool and relaxed and very honest about writing poetry. He didn't glamourize it at all, but made it very real for me.
C.D. is wonderful.  The way she discussed the works we read was truly lovely.
Great Professor! Would take his class again. He made me excited to go to Hindi class. I highly recommend taking his class.

Completely all over the place, and incomprehensibly esoteric. This guy has a love affair with vagueness. He's lovable because of his disorganized, aloof style, but my fondness didn't stop me from disliking the class. the strangest attempt at a Literature class, not to mention and East Asian studies class, that i have experienced. NOT recommended.
Having class with him is like  hanging you with a bunch of smart people. Two hours feel like a breeze, and it's incredible the amount of material you end up covering.  He rocks, period.
Tough and passionate woman. She pushes you to think and act like a real scientist
Fantastic professor! One of the best I've had at Brown. Gives great lectures and is really caring and approachable. Laura made me love math again.
Awesome guy. Really into what he does.
Pretentious, doesn't like being wrong, not a good lecturer, boring voice, goes super quickly through math that is irrelevant to course, difficult material made more difficult.
Lovely young guy who loves memes!
Long confusing and lengthy lectures, lots of reading and homework. Didn't learn much

comment: Very nice instructor. Explains well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Great professor teaching a great course! It was truly a pleasure to be taught by him.
Direct, funny with real experience to back his perspectives. I will take Ray for other courses.

Professor Bloch will open your mind with amazing lectures and a true open spirit and energy. The class title does not do the course justice because his Crime and the City class is about identity and conflict in public space in so many ways. I tried to get into his urban theory seminar to no avail! Maybe next year.
An excellent prof who made learning calculus with a focus on engineering and physics applications very enjoyable! If you can take a class with him I would recommend doing so

He is a very dedicated professor! I enjoyed going to his lectures because I learned much and left with greater understanding of the material. You'll learn a lot from him since he has a great way to include everyone's opinions and to allow for differing perspectives to be analyzed. Get to know him during office hours -- he's a great person, as well!

Gerbi presents very interesting material, but is unable to bring it down to an understandable level.  Her slides are very cluttered and unhelpful.  I spent hours with classmates deciphering what the freak was going on in her slides in order to prepare for the final exam.  Be prepared to cram because she only worries about memorizing details.
Prof. Webster is very nice and helpful. I knew nothing about biomaterials before i took this course. After participating the course, I gain so much interest about it.

BIOL0280 (Introductory Biochemistry) was co-taught by Professor Salomon and Professor Jogl. Sadly, Prof. Salomon was unclear, unhelpful, and simply unapproachable. His explanations during lecture were vague and the exam questions were random (i.e. a minute detail in one of the 80 slides in a lecture). Biochem could have been a great class...

Prof. Edgar is an expert in his field, and it shows. He is a master of the material. He is also a clear presenter, structures his classes well, and is very engaging. He is very level headed about the material, and is generally very objective, even with highly charged, polarizing issues.

Beware: Inexperienced teaching skills and inflexible office hours prevent students from experiencing quality education that is expected from such a prestigious university as Brown. He is a post-doctorate candidate, whom I believe isn't qualified for teaching a graduate level course
Professor Martin was a good lecturer covering great material. She had a good sense of humor and was engaging to watch. Her breadth of knowledge was inspiring.

Amazing professor. Best professor I've had at Brown. Very clear lectures, excellent explanations, great lecture notes. Very easy to talk to, open to questions, open office hours. His anecdotes were my favorite part of the class. Also, he is the most interesting man in the world.

Thalia is excellent at what she does.  She is unusual and creative and pushes the writers in her class hard to make them better.  I know I improved greatly from having her as a professor.  Plus, sometimes she brings her adorable dog to class, which is always the best.
Anna is best
Prof. Talamini did a great job introducing the class to fiction writing. He is an inspiring and hilarious guy, and I would love to take another class with him.

Avoid this professor at all costs! The class was extremely harder than other semesters. She is also not receptive to questions and she made the lectures very dry. At least you can tell she is knowledgable, but she is very bad at teaching effectively. So many people had to drop the class because of how difficult she made it.

One of the most brilliant minds in medicine. Attended only one lecture but damn if it didn't change my perspective on diagnostic medicine. More than a bit cynical though not without reason. Don't take this class if you can't handle harsh criticism.

Mark Johnson is very enthusiastic about the subjects he teaches and it helps to engage students.  He really tries to make sure students are getting a lot out of his class by being very explicit what is important and where to find relevant information in the textbook.

Good course. Lots of homework, but it was worthwhile. Good use of technology. Professors was informal, and very much not PC. Some students found some of the jokes in 1:1 meetings a little bit racist or awkward, but it wasn't a big deal for me. Overall, a solid course.

Peterpaul is hands down the worst teacher I have ever had. He is often late to his own class, uses the easiest examples from the textbooks in lecture, and often incorrectly teaches material. He also has no concept of time management (dude, you can't introduce a new concept with 2 minutes of class left!). Would never recommend to anyone.

Professor Bush gives great lectures and facilitated discussions that make the reading worth it. Hes very accessible outside of class and his paper feedback is thorough and useful. His assignments are VERY open ended, so if you need prompts and structure, avoid this class like the plague. Take if you like a platform to explore your own interests.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Amazing professor for the Graduate Quantum mechanics courses. Assignments and TAs are very helpful in teaching the material. Course is very well organized one. Recommended.
THE BEST PROFESSOR I have EVER had. I would give anything to take his class again.

I had him for PHP 0310 I loved the class! His powerpoints were lengthy so he had to cover content quickly but he did it very enthusiastically. Content from homework readings will show up on the test, but as long as you study thoroughly a day or two before the test you should do good.
One of the best professors at Brown. Highly recommend!
She is funny and nice as a person but her lectures are SO confusing. Her TAs grade strictly and it is hard to do well in this class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: SO. MUCH. READING. Professor Smith is nice and very wise but my class had to read a book a week. He is a strict grader but does give good feedback.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Terrible teacher.  Lectures were incomprehensible and awkward.  Office hours were somehow even worse.  Do yourself a favor and take this course from anybody else.

Matt is a newer professor, wonderful guy, very approachable and easy to get along with outside of class. His lecture style is chaotic and he doesn't explain well, which I think is why attendance is so low. I think he has a long way to go with working on professionalism and how accessible he is. He dumbed the course down a bit too much imo.

Good professor overall--very informed on topics and clearly intelligent. However, he uses overly wordy language that can make points difficult to follow, and the notes on presentations do not clarify his points. Three readings per week, three response papers, one fieldnote analysis, one final exam, and mandatory discussion sections.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: unclear about how attendance was graded and didn't give great feedback on papers.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment:
The person I am referring to is Dean Robert Shaw.

I did an educational studies independent study.

This guy was terrible. 

I had never gotten a "B grade" at the university. But, I did here, because his expecatations were unclear. He said one thing but did another.

He was just completely incompetent at everything. I do not recommend.

Newman was without question the worst professor I had at Brown. Autocratic, snide, vindictive and not very intelligent, she wanted her students to mouth back exactly what she said. Direct quote to class: "Please don't try to be original in your papers." If you have a  brain, avoid this  woman. If you don't have one, you'll do fine.

Terrible professor. Outdated and ineffective teaching methods. Homeworkproblem sets are unclear and do a poor job of laying out the process that students need to learn. Will trick you on exams and expect you to complete a problem set during the week before the exam. Should not be teaching at Brown. DO NOT take microeconomics with this professor.

Kirstin is a wonderful person and inspiring artist.  She was my professor for an entry level art class, and managed to keep both students who were intending to become majors, and students who just wanted an easy art class during their first semester, interested and engaged.  She's also really funny and nice!

Lacked structure or clear grading criteria, this made study difficult. Gave homework without having us hand it in, six weeks in, he asked for it all. Got upset if you asked questions about previous material. Class had people in their second year of Polish to grad students, some bored others lost. He is well intentioned something just didnt click.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: best

I completely looooove Harry. He is definitely one of my favorite instructors ever. His class is so engaging, you can tell he loves philosophy and he transmits that to his students. In spite of being so young he really knows the content and always has an answer for everyone. His grading system is a little different but I really enjoyed it. 11/10

Professor Kniesche is such a gem. I had him for Historical Crime Fiction, and his passion for the subject shone in every lecture and was a great start to my day. He has excellent taste in books and one of my favorite books ever was from his class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Great lectures, really knows his stuff. Labs were good too. Homeworks were hit or miss.

Jonathan Thumas' class on the Archelogy of Buddhist Japan was both the most challenging and most rewarding experience in my college career. Words cannot describe kind, funny, and caring Jonathan is. He demands a lot from his students, it is quite literally impossible to coast, but it is completely worth it.
Great and hot.

This professor was unable to teach effectively over Zoom and made no effort to appeal provide adequate resources for non in-person students. The professor is not as reachable over email as he claims and many students have said reached out asking for consistent lecture capture but he's ignored them the entire semester.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Testa is amazing. He is an engaging lecturer and extremely caring of his students, assignments always felt reasonable and applicable to the class, and he was a fair grader. He is also quite funny, and creates an enjoyable class environment. Although assigned readings could sometimes be a bit long at first, don't be scared away. Great prof

Brilliant. Able to identify the most integral and novel themes of a text and reveal the inconsistencies and contradictions within it.  Traced the evolution and history of particular concepts through different works by the same author and across authors to give greater meaning to class beyond merely amalgamating information.

Dr Clark is an amazing lecturer who is truly invested in her students' understanding in the material. This survey course gives a great introduction to public health, with many guest lecturers that are very interesting. Dr Clark is very clear, friendly, and enthusiastic. Don't miss the opportunity to take this class.
Extremely demanding instructor. Love her use of music in the class -- definitely helpful and funny.

Assigned 2 papers, each worth 40% and 50% of the total grade--with a tiny 10% being reserved for attendance. I would recommend Bewes if you're really into the material but otherwise he can get a bit theoretical and frustrating.
My favorite professor so far at Brown! She is a credit to Brown University and really cares about the students. Come to class, read a lot, and you will do well. Highly recommend her!
Very good professor and this is a very good course all-around: He explains everything clearly, but you can watch his lectures online or read his notes. Homework assignments are tough, but helpful.
CS 31 is the most entertaining and most informative class on Computer Science that I've ever taken.

According to the critical review, most students felt that the class was difficult and not good for students not concentrating in Applied Math.   However, the professor himself was described as an effective teacher. More than 3/4 of the respondents also indicated that the grading policy seemed fair. A decent professor.

He doesn't teach in the History Department this term but he's a historian at the John Carter Brown Library who was enormously kind and helpful to me while I was working on a project there about colonial America. He is really knowledgeable and approachable and funny. If he teaches a class in the spring, definitely take it.

Dr. Keigwin parades around his Dean's award. He deserves it ... barely; he teaches just slightly better than his colleague Dr. England. Note: prepare diligently for unannounced OB/GYN pop-quizzes - they will make or break your evaluation. Also note: avoid purchasing cigarettes at Cumberland Farms next door - his wife will find out.
Awesome professor - explains everything really well and makes the material interesting. Super nice, and helpful. Great sense of humor. Really cares about students!
I have been really enjoying his class so far, exactly the econ class that I was looking for. He definitely knows what he's talking about and a little bit of British accent doesn't hurt at all :)
Best class I've ever taken, Brendan is super enlightening and super hot.

The class is very lecture heavy but Dr. Davis gives good information in the lectures. There are several papers and lots of readings to do. If you pay attention in the class you'll do fine. The discussion portions of the class are engaging and helpful to understand the material.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Extremely rude in one-on-one meetings. Unclear about expectations and downright mean when writing exams. Do not take Orgo with this professor, you will regret it. His lectures, consisting of writing on his iPad, are very difficult to follow, especially because his handwriting is so hard to read and he moves into new topics without introducing them.

Very funny and personable in class, and very easy to approach when you don't understand something or you want to know more. Very understanding on a personal level as well. There was homework every day, but if you were pressed for time she had no problem with you turning it in late some days. One of the best professors I've ever had.

Very thorough lecturing and engaged with the class a lot. Homework was relevant and not too long. A little aloof at times, but generally understanding of personal matters and interesting to talk with about higher concepts.

Brian Lander is an excellent Professor. He taught some of my favourite courses in undergrad. He gave excellent, concise lectures and encouraged students to develop their public speaking skills. Not an especially light course, but Prof. Lander was always very considerate about late assignments within reason.

The best professor I've had so far. He's deeply enthusiastic and knowledgeable about the subject - starts every class with music from the region he's teaching about. Would highly recommend going to office hours - he's super chill and engaging.

Prof Choi continues to be the most confusing person I've met. She is, at times, condescending and passive aggressive. She relies heavily on TA/Student led activities. She leads interesting lectures, but creates an atmosphere that you're scared to engage in. Take class if content seems interesting. Seems a little full of herself and her work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: ENGN30 is not the most interesting of curricula, but Haberstroh does a solid job with it. She cares about all of her students and is very accessible by email and office hours. The course is meh but everyone likes her as a teacher!
No availability outside class, lack of structure, and disengaged classroom discussion. Although an easy "pass," I would have much rather spent my time actually improving my writing.

Emily Steinlight is not only brilliant but a kind, approachable human being that made my senior year in undergrad much less tough than it could have been. One word from her and you will know she is amazingly smart, another word you'll fall in love with her personality. One of the best.

Professor Song was my favorite professor last term. She uses powerpoint slides that are posted online beforehand and will take all her time to explain whatever you don't understand. Tests aren't too hard, there is no homework and she's not a tough grader. She usually conducts small experiments in class to clarify the material.

Erica was a wonderful teacher.  She was bright, funny, inspiring and engaging, even though poetry is not my usual genre of choice.  As a young, politically active teacher, she really gave me someone to look up to.

Kym is an excellent, but by no means easy professor.  Her grading isn't so harsh, but her criticism of your work is.  This is a good thing, as it is helpful for a growing actor to get some real feedback.
Prof. Owens is an amazing teacher who is very passionate about social research.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Says uh every other word. Hard to understand. Doesn't explain much. Would definitely not recommend taking his class.
One of the best lecturers at Brown. Not an easy class by any means, but well worth the time.

Professor Osayimwese was awesome -- gave great, very clear lectures and covered a ton of African diasporic architectural and urban history that you won't encounter in many other classes. She gave good feedback and was always available to help and super accessible.

A cohesive curriculum and well researched class content. Does his best to incorporate everyones learning objectives into the syllabus and is always available for feedback. He isnt afraid to make his opinions known, but is equally as fearless to have them challenged, and is open to all points of view. Great professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Stay away. Lorin doesn't seem to care about teaching students. He made a passing comment on how this was a was a waste of his time because he could be writing grants & hiring students to work for him instead. It is an easy class to get an A in because the material is easy to learn from the textbook but I'd say Lorin isn't an effective lecturer.

He is the worst Professor I know at Brown University in terms of teaching skills and commitment to the course. It was so obvious that he comes to the class unprepared. He spend a big portion of time debugging his own code. Cancel classes one hour before multiple times. Use online tutorials to cover sections of the course. His lectures are useless.

Alberto is one chill guy.  He's very organized and very good about accomodating students (always willing to give you extra time, doesn't give tests, takes you on lots of field trips).  Very enthusiastic about what he does, very approachable, very funny.  His accent makes everything more interesting. Lectures are a bit tedious.

Professor Rieppel is in the Science, Technology, and Society department and taught the introductory course of this concentration. Lectures were nearly all discussion-based, for better or worse. However, he is a nice guy. At times I wish they had been more learning based rather than reiterations of what we read, but overall he teaches well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Horrible professor, does not give you much individual feedback or grades until after your final grade has been decided

Very sweet, accommodating professor. Lectures occasionally tended on the less engaging side, but this had to do a lot more with COVID burnout on all of our parts and difficulties teaching online than any fault of Professor Nelson's. In a normal semester, I would highly recommend the course.

Dr. Goedel's course is divided into two parts: lecture and ArcGIS Pro software, as long as you follow the tutorial to learn the software, the homework is not difficult at all. The only problem is that Dr. Goedel is too busy to answer emails, so I suggest you go to Officehour to ask questions.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: high expectations and she will make you work, but she gives you the tools to do well if you take them. best professor at brown

Professor Guduru draws very clear and simple diagrams that illustrate important, basic concepts well. He is also very receptive to student feedback, adjusting for time zones and general student stress.

They are a wonderful professor. By far my favorite at this school. If you have a chance to take their class, TAKE IT. Captivating lectures, easy grading, and overall a very understanding and kind environment. She cares about her students greatly and made class enjoyable and interesting. TAKE THEIR COURSES!!
